data.title: The Aristocats
data.text:
sex

A very mild reference occurs in the lyrics of a song in which a woman sings 'If you want to turn me on...'

discrimination

The film employs outdated stereotyping in its depiction of a Siamese cat. "]

dangerous behaviour

There is a scene in which the antagonist places sleeping pills in milk to render the cats unconscious, and in another scene he places them in a sack and puts them in an oven, although it is not switched on. The cats also walk along a railway line at one point, but are scared away when a train approaches.

Threat & horror

Sequences include cats battling a human, who attempts to squewer a cat on a pitch fork.

sex

A very mild reference occurs in the lyrics of a song in which a woman sings 'If you want to turn me on...'

The film employs outdated stereotyping in its depiction of a Siamese cat. "]
